title: Laundry Research
text: This homepage contains information and results from the research conducted by Erik Klint. For the proper cited references, please see Published aritcles

title: About
text: Erik Klint is a Ph.D. student at the department of Technology Management and Economics at Chalmers University of Technology, Gothenburg. His research concerns environmental emissions from domestic laundering; both from a life cycle perspective as well as with regard to consumer motivations in changed behaviors. This homepage explains the results from his research and provide additional information concerning the subject.

title: Consumer motivations
text:
As described by Klint, Johansson, and Peters (2022), current research indicate that laundering behaviours are predominantly shaped by three different factors: Social conventions (i.e. culture), individual concerns (e.g. psychological drivers and barriers), and the availability of technological aids (e.g. washing machines or tumble dryers). In turn, these factors also shape one another while at the same time changing over time, see Figure 1.
